conclusion: To determine the magnitude of the object's velocity when the displacement is \( x_1 \), analyze the graph and use kinematics.

The graph shows acceleration \( a \) vs. displacement \( x \). From \( x = 0 \) to \( x = x_1 \), acceleration \( a \) is constant at \( a_0 \). At \( x = x_1 \), acceleration decreases linearly to zero at \( x = x_3 \).
Use the kinematic equation \( v^2 = u^2 + 2a\Delta x \) relating velocity, acceleration, and displacement.
The object starts from rest, so initial velocity \( u = 0 \). Acceleration \( a \) is constant from \( x = 0 \) to \( x = x_1 \) and equals \( a_0 \).
At \( x = x_1 \), initial velocity \( u = 0 \), acceleration \( a = a_0 \), displacement \( \Delta x = x_1 \). Substitute into kinematic equation: \( v^2 = 0^2 + 2a_0x_1 \), so \( v^2 = 2a_0x_1 \).
Taking the square root of both sides gives \( v = \sqrt{2a_0x_1} \).
The magnitude of the object's velocity when the displacement is \( x_1 \) is \( \sqrt{2a_0x_1} \).
